name: Road density
functionStatement: Runoff and infiltration sustain natural flow regime, carry appropriate sediment and nutrients from uplands, and reliably cue spawning/migration of aquatic life.
descriptionMarkdown: Road density is low enough to avoid significant runoff or sediment inputs, consistent with minimal watershed impact.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Sum total road length inside the watershed boundary and divide by watershed area (km roads per km2) using a roads layer.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: <0.5 km roads per km2. Few crossings.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: 1-2 km per km2. Noticeable effect on runoff and sediment.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: >2 km per km2, or frequent crossings delivering heavy pollution.
